content:
• Tuesday, April 9, 2013
  • SEAC

    SeaChange (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $44.6M misses by $0.09M....

    SeaChange (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $44.6M misses by $0.09M. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • ACTS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ACTS +8%. PSUN +6%. PZE +5%. PSMT +4%. NAVB +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ACTS +8%. PSUN +6%. PZE +5%. PSMT +4%. NAVB +3%.
    After-hours top losers: SGYP -12%. HMA -11%. SEAC -10%. RLGY -7%. THC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • INFI

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) loses ground after announcing a non-dilutive public...

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) loses ground after announcing a non-dilutive public offering of 8.5M shares. Beacon and Rosebay and Purdue Pharma are the selling shareholders, offering 4.25M common units each. Shares -2.75% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) announces a $90M secondary offering, with an overallotment...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SGYP) announces a $90M secondary offering, with an overallotment authorization totalling $103.5M of its common stock if the underwriters exercise their over-allotment option in full. Shares -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • RLGY

    Realogy (NYSE:RLGY) -6.9% AH after issuing downside guidance, expecting to post Q1 sales of...

    Realogy (NYSE:RLGY) -6.9% AH after issuing downside guidance, expecting to post Q1 sales of $950M-$960M vs. consensus analysts estimate of $997M. The parent company of Century 21 and Coldwell Banker also announces a secondary offering of 35M common shares by selling stockholders; RLGY will receive no proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • MATN

    OXiGENE (OXGN) is exploring regulatory approval for Zybrestat to treat anaplastic thyroid cancer...

    OXiGENE (OXGN) is exploring regulatory approval for Zybrestat to treat anaplastic thyroid cancer in the European Union with a marketing authorization application under an exceptional or conditional circumstances pathway. The special conditions would allow it to receive approval without conducting another clinical trial and for substantially less cost. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • XAN

    Resource Capital (RSO) slides after announcing a public offering of 16.25M common shares, the...

    Resource Capital (RSO) slides after announcing a public offering of 16.25M common shares, the proceeds from which will be used for general corporate purposes. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • BG

    Bunge (NYSE:BG) announces the appointment of Todd Bastean as CEO, Bunge North America, effective...

    Bunge (NYSE:BG) announces the appointment of Todd Bastean as CEO, Bunge North America, effective June 1. Mr. Bastean, who is currently CFO, will succeed Soren Schroder, who will become CEO of BG on the same date. Mr. Schroder will be replacing retiring CEO Alberto Weisser, who announced he was leaving earlier this year. Share +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +3.5%) finish solidly in the green today as investors continue to expect...

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +3.5%) finish solidly in the green today as investors continue to expect Risk Evaluation and Mitigations Strategy modification for Qsymia. Cowen specutlates that many shorts are covering positions ahead of the decision. As of the end of March, over 26M shares, or 26% of the float, was being held short.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • ADM

    Results from privately-held agribusiness giant Cargill could offer a glimpse of what to expect...

    Results from privately-held agribusiness giant Cargill could offer a glimpse of what to expect when Archer Daniels Midland (ADM -1.7%) and Bunge (BG -1.4%) report later this month. Cargill reported FQ3 net earnings fell 42% Y/Y while revenues edged 1% higher to $32B; its North American business was hit by the lingering U.S. drought, and four of its five business segments posted lower results Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU +2%) trades up after announcing positive colorectal cancer treatment data...

    Immunomedics (IMMU +2%) trades up after announcing positive colorectal cancer treatment data earlier today. The drug developer says its proprietary antibody-drug conjugate, labetuzumab-SN-38, appears to be safe and reasonably well tolerated in patients with advanced colorectal cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • NTR

    Agrium’s (AGU -2.2%) directors win re-election, fending off a dissident slate of nominees...

    Agrium’s (AGU -2.2%) directors win re-election, fending off a dissident slate of nominees from Jana Partners. Jana accuses AGU of revoking votes for Jana’s nominees to win the proxy battle, claiming two of its five candidates would have been elected if not for maneuvering by AGU.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANV

    On a rare good day for mining stocks, Allied Nevada (ANV +29.3%) is surging after saying it's on...

    On a rare good day for mining stocks, Allied Nevada (ANV +29.3%) is surging after saying it's on track to meet six-month production guidance of 90K-100K oz. of gold; it sold 27.2K oz. of gold and 174K oz. of silver in Q1. ANV also expects to complete the expansion of its Hycroft mine on schedule, and without exceeding its $1.2B budget.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +4%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral by Mizuho Securities, raising it's price...

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +4%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral by Mizuho Securities, raising it's price target from $12 to $14. Mizuho says that after being nearly halved over the past seven months due to growth concerns, consensus 2013 estimates are achievable. The company still has plenty of room for growth in uni-knees, the firm notes, even when you account for new robotics competitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • RJETQ

    Shares of Republic Airways (RJET +3.4%) move higher with rumors circulating on a possible push...

    Shares of Republic Airways (RJET +3.4%) move higher with rumors circulating on a possible push by P-E firms to buy Frontier Airlines from the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • PBR

    Recent weakness in international crude and fuel prices combined with a stronger domestic...

    Recent weakness in international crude and fuel prices combined with a stronger domestic currency are helping Petrobras (PBR +5.4%) narrow its losses, Citi says, substantially lowering PBR's fuel price discount to parity to 6.3% and 7.5% for gasoline and diesel, respectively, vs. an average 11% at last month's diesel price hike. The firm sees room for further fuel price rises in the next six months.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • HLF

    As the market clamors over finding the name of KPMG rogue auditor on the Herbalife (HLF -5%)...

    As the market clamors over finding the name of KPMG rogue auditor on the Herbalife (HLF -5%) account (he's purportedly been identified), the stock has taken a hit from another source, DA Davidson, who downgraded the shares mid-day on concerns that the company, through no fault of their own, could now be out of compliance with NYSE requirements. Davidson Analyst Tim Ramey says he expects the company to get a de-listing notice from the NYSE because of the withdrawn audit opinion, although he doubts it will be actually be de-listed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 7 Comments
  • NTR

    Agrium (AGU -2.3%) shares sink as the company announces a delay at its annual general meeting....

    Agrium (AGU -2.3%) shares sink as the company announces a delay at its annual general meeting. Shareholders are voting on replacing select board members, which follows a proxy fight with top shareholder Jana Partners; votes will be announced in ~45 minutes. Shares had been higher after a $0.50/share dividend was declared.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • ABMD

    Shares of Abiomed (ABMD -3.6%) suffer after Piper Jaffray downgrades the stock to Neutral with a...

    Shares of Abiomed (ABMD -3.6%) suffer after Piper Jaffray downgrades the stock to Neutral with a reiterated price target of $18, citing potential drag from FDA premarket approval requirements. On the bright side, "a growing product pipeline [and] the potential for movement into new markets such as Japan … should put a floor under the shares," according to analyst Brooks West. 

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie (ABBV +3%) rises after Goldman reiterates a Buy rating on the shares and raises its price...

    AbbVie (ABBV +3%) rises after Goldman reiterates a Buy rating on the shares and raises its price target to $45 from $42. "Humira scripts were stronger than expected in Q1," says analyst Jami Rubin, before adding that there is now "increased visibility on pipeline assets." Goldman also sees upward pressure on earnings going forward. 

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • FCN

    FTI Consulting (FCN -7.2%) falls after Deutsche Bank says weakness in M&A and IPOs could...

    FTI Consulting (FCN -7.2%) falls after Deutsche Bank says weakness in M&A and IPOs could cause revenues to trend downward. The bank says it is cautious on FTI's earnings call but maintains a Hold rating on the shares. 
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +23.8%) guides on its analyst day for 2013 revenue of $3.8B-$4B and EPS of...

    First Solar (FSLR +23.8%) guides on its analyst day for 2013 revenue of $3.8B-$4B and EPS of $4-$4.50, far above a consensus of $3.15B and $3.46. Shares have spiked higher on the news, and were shortly halted due to volatility. Other solar names are also surging: SPWR +9.8%. TSL +8.7%. DQ +12.3%. STP +36.1%. LDK +15%. JKS +15.4%. WFR +7.5%. JASO +6.6%. (previous) Update (1:56): First Solar shares are now up 48.2%, and have been halted again. CNNMoney's Paul R. La Monica notes over 1/3 of the float is shorted. "Can you say squeeze?"

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 9 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +10.9%) trades up on news that a leading patent lawyer will give...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +10.9%) trades up on news that a leading patent lawyer will give an opinion on the patent position of it's Zerenex. Concern is that KERX won't be able to protect the phosphate binder from generic challengers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • CACH

    Shares of Cache (OTC:CACH -14.5%) slump after the ex-rights date for its rights offering...

    Shares of Cache (OTC:CACH -14.5%) slump after the ex-rights date for its rights offering expires. Holders of the rights can exercise the option for additional shares of common stock before April 25.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • XRM

    Xerium Technologies (XRM +8.7%) charges to the top of the "percentage gainers" list as the...

    Xerium Technologies (XRM +8.7%) charges to the top of the "percentage gainers" list as the industrial-textile maker reports preliminary Q1 results showing 53% Y/Y EBITDA growth, $10.3M in cash flow, and a net Y/Y decrease in leverage. The company also says it may refinance its senior secured term loan and revolver. 

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • LVLT

    A bullish coverage launch from Deutsche leads Level 3 (LVLT +6.2%) to jump above $21. Analyst...

    A bullish coverage launch from Deutsche leads Level 3 (LVLT +6.2%) to jump above $21. Analyst Brett Feldman is encouraged by continued strength in global IP traffic growth (he sees 4x growth through 2016), and forecasts upcoming "inflection points" in the carrier's revenue, free cash flow, and net income growth, something that should allow it to make good use of the net operating losses (NOLs) it has amassed over the years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -8.8%) takes a hit today after announcing that it is expanding...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -8.8%) takes a hit today after announcing that it is expanding workforce reductions in an effort to reduce costs. It now says it plans to cut up to 21% of its workforce, with allowance for with sufficient resources for at least the next 12 months as the Company pursues three key objectives: FDA approval for its MelblezTM Kit, European commercialization of CHEMOSAT Hepatic Delivery System for melphalan hydrochloride, and ongoing clinical development focused on label expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • PRI

    Primerica (PRI +2.9%) trades higher after Raymond James upgrades shares to Outperform, and sets...

    Primerica (PRI +2.9%) trades higher after Raymond James upgrades shares to Outperform, and sets a $39 PT. Though shares have been range-bound for much of 2013, the insurance underwriter is within striking distance of its 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • GLBR

    FXCM's (FXCM +2.3%) bid for Gain Capital (GCAP +26%) would merge two of largest U.S.-based...

    FXCM's (FXCM +2.3%) bid for Gain Capital (GCAP +26%) would merge two of largest U.S.-based players in online FX trading, as FXCM pushes for organic growth in an industry that has grown rapidly over the past decade but is now challenged by tighter regulation and waning profits. Retail trading currently accounts for about 6% of the $4T per day currency market, and FXCM reported earlier today that its retail and institutional volumes fell in March on both a Y/Y and M/M comparisons.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • SSTK

    Shares of Shutterstock (SSTK +4.1%) rally with reports on the company's new Offset brand...

    Shares of Shutterstock (SSTK +4.1%) rally with reports on the company's new Offset brand creating a bit of a buzz. Offset hopes to be a must-have for glossy editorial magazines and high-end advertising agencies after it comes out of beta.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • SHLM

    Shares of Schulman (SHLM -11.5%) tack further losses on to yesterday's post-session dip, after...

    Shares of Schulman (SHLM -11.5%) tack further losses on to yesterday's post-session dip, after the company reported a big miss on its FQ2 earnings late yesterday. The company blames the miss on weakening macro trends, adding that it's continuing to pare back operations globally in an effort to curb operational costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -0.7%) peer NuSkin (NUS -0.3%) breathes a sigh of relief, paring most of its...

    Herbalife (HLF -0.7%) peer NuSkin (NUS -0.3%) breathes a sigh of relief, paring most of its losses on HLF's somewhat uneventful reopen and a lack of carnage following a NYSE record-long halt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (ANGO -1.8%) slides on a mixed FQ3, beating on a per share basis but missing on...

    AngioDynamics (ANGO -1.8%) slides on a mixed FQ3, beating on a per share basis but missing on sales. Despite the miss, net losses narrowed as the company recorded stronger sales in its vascular segment, though margins weakened. For FY 2013, the company bracketed analysts estimates, saying it expects sales of $337M to $341M and EPS of $0.32 to $0.35. The Street is at $340.8M in sales on earnings of $0.33 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +10.3%) soars on heavy volume after Cantor Fitzgerald raises its...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +10.3%) soars on heavy volume after Cantor Fitzgerald raises its price target on the shares to $15 from $12. Irina Rivkind says the company's lead investigational drug plecanatide can "achieve revenue parity" with Ironwood (IRWD -0.5%) and Forest Laboratories' (FRX -0.2%) Linzess, an FDA approved treatment for constipation. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • HLF

    At least one Herbalife (HLF -1.4%) shareholder says that not only won't he sell his shares on...

    At least one Herbalife (HLF -1.4%) shareholder says that not only won't he sell his shares on the KPMG news, but he'd be a buyer if it gets cheap. Activist investor Robert Chapman Jr. has been betting on HLF for some time, and says he's "very long" and will double his position today if it falls materially.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 5 Comments
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS +4.5%) and 3D Systems (DDD +4.5%) jump after Canaccord starts coverage on...

    Stratasys (SSYS +4.5%) and 3D Systems (DDD +4.5%) jump after Canaccord starts coverage on Stratasys with a Buy and $82 PT. ExOne (XONE +1.6%) is up more modestly. Stratasys and 3D are respectively down 11% and 7% on the year, as shares digest their huge 2012 gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    After an unprecedent halt, shares of Herbalife (HLF -0.9%) resume trading, currently at $38.11.

    After an unprecedent halt, shares of Herbalife (HLF -0.9%) resume trading, currently at $38.11.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN +1.7%) gets a lift today as Goldman reiterates its Buy recommendation and raises...

    Regeneron (REGN +1.7%) gets a lift today as Goldman reiterates its Buy recommendation and raises its price target on the shares to $215 from $196 citing relative YTD underperformance versus the Nasdaq Biotech index and a strong Eylea launch. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • VALE

    Brazil’s government reportedly is working to change how it taxes its companies’...

    Brazil’s government reportedly is working to change how it taxes its companies’ foreign subsidiaries, which BAML says could provide a boost for Vale (VALE +4.4%) since it "creates a more coherent and stable taxation." Also, Vale receives an operating permit for maritime terminal CLN 150, a step the miner calls crucial toward expanded Carajas iron ore production capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM -28%) does an about-face following yesterday's big run, giving back it all...

    BSD Medical (BSDM -28%) does an about-face following yesterday's big run, giving back it all plus more after saying it's entered into a securities purchase agreement with two institutional investors to sell around 4,065,042 shares of its common stock in a registered direct offering at $1.23 per share, plus warrants to purchase 3,048,782 shares. The placement price represents a 25% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • NUAN

    A rumor Nuance (NUAN +3.3%) has hired Goldman to explore strategic alternatives is fueling a...

    A rumor Nuance (NUAN +3.3%) has hired Goldman to explore strategic alternatives is fueling a rally in shares of the voice recognition giant. Needless to say, Carl Icahn's newfound interest in the company have much to do with investor hopes for a major payoff. 11% of the float was shorted as of March 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +5.6%) is shooting higher as its analyst day presentations are made (webcast);...

    First Solar (FSLR +5.6%) is shooting higher as its analyst day presentations are made (webcast); the solar giant has struck an upbeat tone about demand and long-term margins thus far. Ahead of the presentations, First Solar announced it had developed a CdTe thin-film solar module with a 16.1% efficiency in lab tests; that's soundly above a prior record of 14.4%, and (assuming eventual production) narrows the historical efficiency edge held by silicon modules. First Solar has also rolled out new Series 3 modules, and raised its efficiency targets for 2015 and 2017.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • JCP

    Fresh takes on J.C. Penney (JCP -11.7%): 1) Piper Jaffray calls the company "powerless" to...

    Fresh takes on J.C. Penney (JCP -11.7%): 1) Piper Jaffray calls the company "powerless" to prevent a further deterioration of sales, expecting another $1B in cash to get burned up this year. 2) Deutsche Bank warns that with Bill Ackman losing his influence with the retailer's board he could lighten his stake and put significant pressure on shares. 3) Hedgeye thinks a sale might be a way out of the morass for new CEO Myron Ullman. "He could help to put lipstick on the pig and get it sold." (JCP timeline)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +3.8%) rallies after announcing the European Patent Office has issued a notice...

    VirnetX (VHC +3.8%) rallies after announcing the European Patent Office has issued a notice indicating it intends to grant VirnetX a patent related to 3rd-party VPN certification. The company's patent suits against Apple and Cisco involve VPN-related IP. (PR) (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • SKX

    Shares of Skechers (SKX +1.7%), also a KPMG client, are halted with news pending.

    Shares of Skechers (SKX +1.7%), also a KPMG client, are halted with news pending.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 5 Comments
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) peers are trading mixed after a bout of brief volatility on the...

    Shares of Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) peers are trading mixed after a bout of brief volatility on the KPMG news, as the event appears to be contained: Nu Skin (NUS -1.9%), USANA Health Sciences (USNA -0.7%), Blyth (BTH +0.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +9.9%) strikes a deal to supply over108K 300W solar modules to U.S. solar...

    ReneSola (SOL +9.9%) strikes a deal to supply over108K 300W solar modules to U.S. solar developer Strata Solar for use in five 6.5MW North Carolina solar farms. Deliveries will be made in June/July. Shares are shooting higher, but remain well below mid-February levels. (Solairedirect deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • M

    Department store stocks (M, SKS, SHLD, KSS, DDS) are trading lower in the wake of the divorce of...

    Department store stocks (M, SKS, SHLD, KSS, DDS) are trading lower in the wake of the divorce of Ron Johnson from J.C. Penney and a report on retail chain store sales that leaned to the soft side. It's a move that some analysts see as slightly curious with the weather-related delay to the spring selling season only a temporary bump and with J.C. Penney seemingly a punch or two away from a knockout that could bleed some sales to peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • Z

    Zillow's (Z +2.4%) Q1 Premier Agent subscriber growth exceeded expectations, thinks Pac Crest...

    Zillow's (Z +2.4%) Q1 Premier Agent subscriber growth exceeded expectations, thinks Pac Crest following a survey of agent profiles. As a result, the firm expects Zillow to beat Q1 revenue estimates. Both Zillow and rival Trulia (TRLA +2.1%) are trading higher; Zillow has nearly doubled YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • NUS

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS -1.8%) trade lower after news of the resignation of Herbalife's auditor...

    Shares of Nu Skin (NUS -1.8%) trade lower after news of the resignation of Herbalife's auditor breaks.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • AA

    Several big miners are advancing after Alcoa (NYSE:AA) last night said global end market demand...

    Several big miners are advancing after Alcoa (NYSE:AA) last night said global end market demand growth was solid and it continues to expect global aluminum demand to rise 7% in 2013. In early trading, RIO +3.3%, BHP +2.2%, VALE +2.6%, FCX +2.1%, CLF +4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 4 Comments
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (CNQR -2.8%) falls as Oppenheimer downgrades the shares to Underperform...

    Concur Technologies (CNQR -2.8%) falls as Oppenheimer downgrades the shares to Underperform citing unrealistic organic growth expectations. Analyst Brian Schwartz also notes hiring trends are weaker and says soft mid-market and booking trends could pressure margins. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • HEAR

    Parametric (PAMT -6%) slumps after announcing it's not pursuing a PIPE financing deal as part of...

    Parametric (PAMT -6%) slumps after announcing it's not pursuing a PIPE financing deal as part of its evaluation of strategic options. The audio tech developer adds it has received "substantial licensing proposals" for its HyperSound tech, and has been "approached by several industry leaders in key target verticals to pursue strategic discussions." The announcement comes 2 weeks after Parametric disclosed it had hired boutique i-bank Houlihan Lokey. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • HLF

    KPMG apparently confirms a report that it has resigned as Herbalife's (NYSE:HLF) auditor.

    KPMG apparently confirms a report that it has resigned as Herbalife's (NYSE:HLF) auditor.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • REMY

    Auto parts stocks take a turn higher with news from Fiat and General Motors boding well for...

    Auto parts stocks take a turn higher with news from Fiat and General Motors boding well for manufacturing. Advancers: Remy International (NASDAQ:REMY) +2.7%, WABCO Holdings (NYSE:WBC) +2.4%, Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) +1.1%, Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) +1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • AFFX

    Affymetrix (AFFX -12%) plummets after announcing preliminary Q1 revenue of $78M, missing analyst...

    Affymetrix (AFFX -12%) plummets after announcing preliminary Q1 revenue of $78M, missing analyst estimates of ~$83M. The company blamed "continued headwinds" in the gene expression business. Citing the pre-earnings quiet period, AFFX says it will make no further statements until its call on April 30. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) is reportedly poised to reveal that KPMG will have to resign as the...

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) is reportedly poised to reveal that KPMG will have to resign as the company’s auditor after the accounting firm sacked a partner for providing inside information to an unnamed person who then traded the shares of several companies on the West Coast. Herbalife's shares remain suspended.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • QLIK

    Qlik (QLIK +2.4%) rallies following an upgrade to Overweight from Evercore; the firm has set a...

    Qlik (QLIK +2.4%) rallies following an upgrade to Overweight from Evercore; the firm has set a $30 PT. Shares traded higher yesterday as the company's annual partner summit commenced.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) +5.4% after Craig-Hallum raises its PT to a Street high of $58 from $31...

    UniPixel (NASDAQ:UNXL) +5.4% after Craig-Hallum raises its PT to a Street high of $58 from $31 on account of yesterday's announcement of a UniBoss partnership with a "major touchscreen ecosystem partner." The firm thinks UniPixel "has a good chance to become a $300+ million revenue company by 2015."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 5 Comments
  • MCC

    Medley Capital (NYSE:MCC) will offer 4M shares and use the proceeds to repay a portion of...

    Medley Capital (NYSE:MCC) will offer 4M shares and use the proceeds to repay a portion of outstanding debt under its revolving credit facility, fund new investment opportunities and for general corporate purposes. The investment company had ~28.7M shares outstanding as of Jan. 14. Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stocks look set to follow Europe and start the day higher after falling...

    Market preview: U.S. stocks look set to follow Europe and start the day higher after falling inflation in China and encouraging industrial production data out of the U.K., although German domestic demand isn't looking too hot. S&P futures are +0.1%. J.C. Penney slumps 7.4%, with investors aghast at the return of Myron Ullman to replace Ron Johnson as CEO.
